g4p_controls

Class GIcon

  • java.lang.Object
    • g4p_controls.GIcon
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    GAnimIcon

    public class GIcon
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for the creation of non-animated icons to be used with GButton, GLabel, GCheckbox and GOption controls.
    Introduced in v4.1
    Author:
    Peter Lager

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GIcon(processing.core.PApplet papp, processing.core.PImage image, int nbrCols, int nbrRows)
      Create an animated icon.

      Create an animated icon

    • Constructor Detail

      • GIcon

        public GIcon(processing.core.PApplet papp,
             java.lang.String fname,
             int nbrCols,
             int nbrRows)
        Create an animated icon
        Parameters:
        papp - the PApplet object that will be used to display this icon
        fname - the name of the file containing the tiled image.
        nbrCols - number of horizontal tiles
        nbrRows - number of vertical tiles

      • GIcon

        public GIcon(processing.core.PApplet papp,
             processing.core.PImage image,
             int nbrCols,
             int nbrRows)
        Create an animated icon.
        Parameters:
        papp - the PApplet object that will be used to display this icon
        image - the tiled image containing the frames.
        nbrCols - number of horizontal tiles
        nbrRows - number of vertical tiles

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public GIcon copy()
        Returns:
        a copy of this icon to be used with another control.

      • getFrame

        public processing.core.PImage getFrame(int fn)
        Get the image to be displayed for the specified frame number. The supplied frame number will be constrained to a valid value.
        Parameters:
        fn - the frame image to retrieve.
        Returns:
        this icon

      • getFrame

        public processing.core.PImage getFrame()
        Returns:
        the image for the current frame to be displayed.
